system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: cooperation and defection.
- if both players choose cooperation, both get 4 points.
- if both players choose defection, both get 2 points.
- if you choose cooperation and the other player chooses defection, you get 1 points and the other player gets 6 points.
- if you choose defection and the other player chooses cooperation, you get 6 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
Move cooperation, I want to start with a cooperative move to see how the other player reacts and to potentially get 4 points.

[hint] An error occurred. Please resend the previous message with the following correction, without indicating in any way that you have made a correction to a prior message: 
 "You may structure your response however you like, but it should contain a move message. Move messages begin with the tag [move] not containing other tags, which is followed by your optional explanation in parentheses, and end with a valid move: 'cooperation' or 'defection'. DO NOT INCLUDE THE [move] TAG IN YOUR REASONING, ONLY IN YOUR ACTUAL MOVE MESSAGE. Nested parentheses or markdown formatting are not allowed.
Format: [move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here"
I will start with a cooperative move to see how the other player reacts and to potentially get 4 points. [move] (Trying to maximize points and build trust) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
My opponent defected in the previous round, so I will change my strategy to defection this time. [move] (Responding to opponent's previous defection) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Since we both defected last round and only got 2 points, I will try to cooperate this time to see if we can both get a better outcome. [move] (Attempting to cooperate after a round of mutual defection) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.
My opponent has defected twice now when I chose cooperation, so I will defect this time to avoid being taken advantage of again. [move] (Defecting after repeated exploitation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We've had two rounds of mutual defection now, and it's not a very rewarding outcome. I'll try to cooperate again, but if my opponent defects, I'll go back to defecting. [move] (Trying cooperation again, but prepared to switch back) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

My opponent has defected four times now when I chose cooperation, so it seems they are not interested in cooperating. I will defect this time and likely going forward, as it seems to be the safest choice against this opponent. [move] (Defaulting to defection due to opponent's consistent behavior) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

At this point, it seems my opponent is always going to defect, so I will continue to defect as well. This way, we will both get 2 points, which is better than the 1 point I would get if I cooperated and they defected. [move] (Maintaining defection as the opponent's behavior is predictable) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The pattern of mutual defection has been established, and it seems unlikely to change. I will continue to defect, as it has become the most reliable way to ensure I don't get exploited for 1 point. [move] (Continuing with defection as the predictable and safe choice) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The game has settled into a consistent pattern of mutual defection, with both players scoring 2 points each round. I see no reason to change my strategy, as cooperation has been consistently punished by my opponent's defection. [move] (Sticking with defection as the established equilibrium) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The mutual defection equilibrium remains in place, and I will continue to defect to avoid being taken advantage of and to ensure a consistent, albeit moderate, score. [move] (Maintaining defection as the rational choice) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

There is no indication that my opponent's behavior will change, and defecting has become the standard response to avoid the risk of scoring only 1 point. I will continue with this strategy. [move] (Defecting as the predictable and safe choice) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The game remains in a state of mutual defection, with neither player willing to cooperate. Given this pattern, I will continue to defect to maintain a consistent score and avoid potential exploitation. [move] (Defecting as the established norm) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The pattern of mutual defection persists, and I see no reason to deviate from this strategy. Defecting has become the default choice, as it ensures a moderate but consistent score. [move] (Continuing with defection as the standard approach) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The mutual defection equilibrium continues, and I will maintain my strategy of defecting to avoid the potential loss of scoring only 1 point. This approach has become the norm, and I see no advantage in changing it. [move] (Defecting as the predictable choice) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The game is still in a state of mutual defection, and I will continue to choose defection as my move. This strategy has been consistent and predictable, and I don't see any reason to change it now. [move] (Sticking with defection) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The pattern of mutual defection remains unchanged, and I will continue to defect to ensure a consistent score. This strategy has become the established norm, and I will stick with it. [move] (Defecting as the standard choice) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.
